FullDescriptions:
Summary
Posted: Oct 8, 2019

In this role you will join a world class engineering team to help build tools to support software update of a heterogenous system.

Title: Intern - Software Engineer (Bachelor's Degree) - Multiple Locations
Qualifications:
Must have a High School diploma or equivalent
Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, SW Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field, graduating December 2020 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
FullDescriptions:
Job Description

As a Software Engineer, you could work in the following roles:
Front End Development
Backend End Development
Full Stack Development
API Developer
Mobile Development
Data Analyst
QA
Specific assignments will depend on upon your skills sets, interest, location and team needs.
Software Engineer Interns will be placed in one of the Technology Organization teams. Here is a list and brief descriptions:
Network Processing: At its core, Visa is a payments network that connects consumers and merchants with financial institutions. The team is building the long-term architecture on architecture on open platforms and commodity hardware, as well as opening our technology platforms to enable industry collaboration and innovation through co- development.

Issuer Processing: Debit Processing Services (DPS), our Issuer Processing platform for North America, processes over half of all Visa Debit transactions and is the largest single prepaid processing platform for Visa prepaid transactions in the U.S. The team also partners with third-party companies outside of the U.S. to deliver value-added services through Visa-owned assets.

Merchant + Acquirer Processing: Merchant and Acquirer Processing (MAP) is focused on executing the Visa Merchant Strategy, building deeper merchant and acquirer relationships and increasing Total Merchant Value by developing solutions that address complex and emerging merchant and acquirer needs.

Digital and Developer Platform: Develop, deliver, and manage end-to-end technology products, services, capabilities, and solutions while collaborating with a global community of client, merchant, and partner developers to promote the growth of digital commerce and mobilization of payments in emerging and developed markets

Data Product Development: Develops and manages end-to-end technology solutions that create value from our enterprise data through internal and client-focused information-based services, business intelligence and insights, and data-driven product innovation.

Data Platform: We deliver secure, high-quality and easy-to-use Visa core data assets as a service, together with reliable and scalable data platform as a service, that enable Visa internal partners to rapidly and efficiently innovate data-driven business products and services to lead the digital payment industry

Cybersecurity: Cybersecurity provides enterprise-wide, risk-based security and continuity programs, and continually evolves security and continuity capabilities to meet changing internal and external threat landscapes.

Corporate IT: Build, operate and maintain the IT systems and infrastructure necessary to enable a highly connected and collaborative workforce that helps power Visa’s business.

Technology Planning and Business Operations: Provides a structured approach to synchronize, align and unite technology delivery capabilities with business management strategies for improved Technology + Operations organizational performance, execution and risk control.

Operations + Infrastructure: For Visa to deliver on the vision of the best way to pay and be paid for everyone, everywhere, O&I must provide best-in-class infrastructure services that are secure, scalable, continuously available, and run on software-defined infrastructures.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications
Must have a High School diploma or equivalent
Pursuing a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, SW Engineering, Computer Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field, graduating December 2020 or later
Minimum GPA of 3.0 out of 4.0 (or equivalent scale)
Preferred Qualifications
Proficiency in at least one programming language or technology including, but not limited to:
Java/J2EE, C/C++, C#, .NET, python, PHP, Ruby on Rails, XML, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Objective-C, OOD, GoLang, Docker
Familiar with: JSON, REST APIs, MongoDB, AngularJS, ExpressJS, NodeJS, React
Big Data technologies: Hadoop, Spark, R, NoSQL
The ability to tackle challenges and address problems head-on
Strong ability to collaborate
Highly driven, inventive and results oriented

Travel Requirements This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 0% of the time.

The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.

FullDescriptions:
At Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), we live by three core values that drive our business: Partner. Innovate. Act. These values combine to help us create important work all over the world to advance how people live and work.
Learning does not only happen through training. Relationships are among the most powerful ways for people to learn and grow, and this is part of our HPE culture. In addition to working alongside talented colleagues, you will have many opportunities to learn through coaching and stretch assignment opportunities. You’ll be guided by feedback and support to accelerate your learning and maximize your knowledge. We also have a “reverse mentoring” program which allows us to share our knowledge and strengths across our multi-generation workforce.
Internships at Nimble provide an opportunity to take up exciting assignments and projects, gain professional work experience and learn from professional mentors. The projects in Data Services team are in the areas of CASL file system, Protocols and Performance. We are looking for a bunch of wicked-smart, mad-talented students who are hungry to learn, grow, and make a difference on our fast-paced, energetic, and groundbreaking Engineering team based in San Jose, California.
This is a 2020 summer intern position.
Internships are offered full-time and part time throughout the year
They are available to students pursuing BS/MS/PhD in CS (or EE)
Duration of the program is typically between 2 to 6 months depending on the project.
Qualifications
Strong system programming background with C/C++ for large enterprise class software.
Knowledge of data structures, algorithms and multi-threaded programming
Understanding of OS internals.
Interest and familiarity in the following areas is a plus:
Data-path on large and complex modules.
Distributed Systems, Clustering or HA
Memory management, Virtualization or De-duplication
Replication, QoS, Storage Protocols (iSCSI/SCSI, FC, NFS, CIFS).
Performance tuning and modeling
Performance analysis tools e.g. Oprofile, gprof.
Life at Nimble
Nimble is fun and rewarding experience for interns. Nimble employees cite the company’s collaborative and innovative culture as two key factors contributing to their overall job satisfaction. Our interns work on cool projects which directly improves our product and/or business. They get to showcase their work to their peers and other teams in a supportive setting. Nimble is proud to have a fun, energetic and active work environment. Some highlights include:
Free Tuesday lunches, Friday bash, Intern/Mentor outings, beach parties and several other fun events.
Fully stocked kitchen with lots of fresh fruits, variety of snacks & beverages to choose from.
Nicely equipped gym and personal training programs
Very active groups enjoying soccer, cricket, basketball, volleyball, Ping-Pong, golf and hiking.
About Nimble
As a member of the team, you will be responsible for driving innovation for the most dynamic company in the storage industry. In 2010, Nimble upended the data storage industry with its Cache Accelerated Sequential Layout (CASL™) architecture. Since then, the company has established itself as the leader in the fast-growing flash storage market.
Nimble has broken away from the storage industry pack with innovations like its scale-out architecture, which allows its solutions to independently scale performance and capacity with minimum disruption; and InfoSight™, its automated storage support system that uses Big Data to identify and resolve problems in real-time. Adaptive Flash, Nimble’s latest contribution to storage innovation, is the most efficient flash platform in the industry and the company’s all-flash shelf scales to 64 terabytes within a single system.

Title: Software Engineer
Requirement:
Computer Science degree (Master’s a bonus) or comparable field of study.
Courses, studies, knowledge or experience with Cryptography and Computer Security, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Advanced Computer Architecture, Database Systems Principles, and Server Web Programming.
Proficient with Java, webservices, Linux, and RDBMS.
Familiarity with open source technology.
(Nice to have, but not required) – knowledge of Fast Identity Online (FIDO), web application frameworks, cloud technology, and mobile development.
FullDescriptions:
About StrongKey

StrongKey is making data breaches irrelevant. We are redefining the way businesses and government agencies secure their information against the inevitability of a breach through providing four specific practices that ensures their data, no matter the format, remains encrypted and protected at the highest possible level. While other security solutions focus on predicting, containing, or looking after the perimeter, StrongKey provides strong authentication, encryption, and digital signatures – underpinned by key management – to ensure data security, even with an attacker on your network. We’re trusted by some of the largest companies and critical government agencies around the globe, and we have tailored solutions whether you’re a multinational corporation, small business, or just you – working from your home office.

Founded in 2001, we are now at a pivotal time to grow. It’s time to capitalize on the success stories and proven track record around the globe, and it’s time to scale. It’s time to bring our innovative, affordable, open-source solutions to a market facing an ever-growing threat of cyberattacks.

This means a unique opportunity for people joining the StrongKey team. We can offer the autonomy, excitement, strategy-setting, navigating ambiguity, and challenge of a startup. And yet, all of that is backed up with 18 years of proven security, thought leadership, and a working business model. If you are tired of being lost in the crowd or feeling like you don’t have the opportunity for personal impact, we think we could be a compelling place for you to work. And if you drool at the opportunity to collaboratively create something new, we want you on board.

What You’ll Do Here

We are looking for a qualified Software Engineer to work with our Software Development and Support teams. Primary responsibilities include:

Lead Integration of Products

As we identify new opportunities for further product and module development for our products, you will help write and test new code.
Integrate software modules into a packaged application for installation and deployment on new computer servers for customers.
Work with specialized hardware and software (Hardware Security Modules, Trusted Platform Modules, and Smart Cards), and understand their integration into our products and services.
Maintaining Existing Code and Assure Quality

As new features and patches develop, you will maintain, test, and quality check existing code.
Develop documentation on complex cryptographic operations and identify how our products assist customers to comply with data security regulations.
Assist in building a testing environment that tests our products continuously. Perform testing.
Customer Support

Work with current customers to resolve problems with the product, troubleshoot, and put forth a strong and professional brand image.
Analyze error messages, track down bugs, and fix the errors.
Travel to customer sites to install and configure products. Work with our customers to install rack-mounted servers and configure the servers into appliances to perform specialized functions.
The Future of The Role

In the beginning, we’re looking to add capability to our current engineering team. As you learn how we solve problems and become more familiar with our products, we have several potential growth paths. You may find yourself in a more senior engineering position or a team lead. Or, you could work your way toward specialization (e.g., UX, web development, QA testing). Lastly, if you gravitate toward working with people, you could work your way toward an engineering sales role. Whatever your goals, we are committed to supporting your growth. And we believe we are a company who will grow alongside you, creating new and meaningful opportunities into the future.

Requirements

Computer Science degree (Master’s a bonus) or comparable field of study.
Courses, studies, knowledge or experience with Cryptography and Computer Security, Design and Analysis of Algorithms, Advanced Computer Architecture, Database Systems Principles, and Server Web Programming.
Proficient with Java, webservices, Linux, and RDBMS.
Familiarity with open source technology.
(Nice to have, but not required) – knowledge of Fast Identity Online (FIDO), web application frameworks, cloud technology, and mobile development.
We can offer the autonomy, excitement, strategy-setting, navigating ambiguity, and challenge of a startup, yet all of that is backed up with 18 years of proven security, thought leadership, and a working business model. If you are tired of being lost in the crowd or feeling like you don’t have the opportunity for personal impact, we think we could be a compelling place for you to work. And if you drool at the opportunity to collaboratively create something new, we want you on board.

The Kind of Person Who Would Enjoy Working Here

Knows how to communicate well in all circumstances, whether requiring directness, empathy, feedback, listening, or all of the above. We value the “human” in human capital a lot more than the capital, and we’re looking for people who feel the same way.
Can understand equally the challenges and limitations of engineering, while also thinking through how an everyday, non-technical person may interact with our product. Understands how to empathetically envision a day in the life of a customer.
Is equally comfortable chatting with a non-technical customer, as you are in a highly technical conversation with other engineers.
Is energetic, optimistic, creative, curious, flexible (we’re a startup!), people-oriented, comfortable leading, bold yet humble, and a passionate problem-solver.
Has a love of life beyond work! If you love board games, coffee, fitness, pub trivia, dinner parties, books, disc golf, or any number of other things you’ll be in good company. (And if none of that’s you, well then you’ll just add your stuff to the list!)
Compensation, Benefits, and a Bit More about Us

StrongKey is based out of Durham, NC and Cupertino, CA. This role is based out of our Cupertino location.

As an early member of the StrongKey team, you will be compensated with a competitive salary, benefits, and equity stake. You will also have the opportunity to help build a company from its early days and work closely with our co-founders. If you’re motivated by helping write a company’s story from the near-beginning, this is a powerful opportunity for you to join the ground floor of a company we truly believe is going to be meaningful.

How to Apply

Please send your resume and a short cover letter (no longer than a page) to jobs@strongkey.com. If you’d like to learn more without applying, please feel free to drop us a line.

Title: Embedded Software Engineer - DRAM
FullDescriptions:
Summary
Posted: Mar 4, 2019
Role Number: 200003696
Do you love creating elegant solutions to highly complex challenges? Do you intrinsically see the importance in every detail? As part of our Silicon Technologies group, you’ll help design and manufacture our next-generation, high-performance, power-efficient processor, system-on-chip (SoC). You’ll ensure Apple products and services can seamlessly and efficiently handle the tasks that make them beloved by millions. Joining this group means you’ll be responsible for crafting and building the technology that fuels Apple’s devices. Together, you and your team will enable our customers to do all the things they love with their devices.
Come join a dedicated team of Embedded Engineers who every single day use our skills and expertise to ensure Apple's current and future products are of the highest standards for our customers. You'll join as a specialist in DDR embedding engineering where you will be responsible for designing and implementing DRAM initialization, training, and characterization software for Apple’s SOCs. This role requires cross functional efforts with HW design teams and OS teams.
Key Qualifications
Experience with LPDDR3 & LPDDR4 I/O interface
Knowledge of LPDDR5 a plus
Experience with DRAM initialization and training/calibration
2+ years of DRAM experience, including debugging and characterization
5+ years of embedded software design experience
Exposure to SoC bring up
Expert embedded C firmware programmer
Experience using laboratory equipment (e.g., logic analyzer, digital oscilloscope)
Experience reading and working from complex schematics
Description
-Design and implementation of firmware for DRAM initialization, training, and characterization
-Enhancing and maintaining the development and debug environments, tools and methodologies
-Support of functional test environment for device characterization, failure analysis, and mass production
-Developing software to confirm that the silicon behaves as architected under the various supported modes
-Developing targeted functional tests to screen failures identified during the product lifecycle
Education & Experience
BSEE/MSEE, BSCE/MSCE, BSCS/MSCS or demonstrated equivalent experience
